articles.title: Mother, boyfriend charged in death of daughter, 11
articles.description: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) — A Virginia mother has been charged with the murder of her 11-year-old daughter.

articles.title: Head of beleaguered Virginia jail steps down after 1 year
articles.description: PORTSMOUTH, Va. (AP) — After a year on the job, the superintendent of a Virginia jail under federal investigation has stepped down.

articles.title: Head of beleaguered Virginia jail steps down after 1 year
articles.description: PORTSMOUTH, Va. (AP) — After a year on the job, the superintendent of a Virginia jail under federal investigation has stepped down.

articles.author: By Kristine Phillips, The Washington Post
articles.title: She sent her child to school with a recorder to catch bullies – and was charged with a felony
articles.description: A Virginia mother said she was charged with a felony after she sent her daughter to school with an audio recorder in her backpack to see if the child was being bullied at school.

articles.author: BY FRANK GREEN Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Advocacy groups join ACLU in urging Va. governor to curb use of solitary confinement; state DOC contends it does not use the practice
articles.description: Advocacy groups joined the ACLU of Virginia on Thursday in urging Gov. Ralph Northam and other state officials to greatly curb the use of solitary confinement.

articles.author: By DENISE LAVOIE AP Legal Affairs Writer
articles.title: ACLU calls for limits on solitary confinement in Virginia
articles.description: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) — The American Civil Liberties Union of Virginia on Thursday called on Gov. Ralph Northam to sharply limit the use of solitary confinement in state prisons.

articles.author: By Jeff Sturgeon jeff.sturgeon@roanoke.com 981-3251
articles.title: Roanoke mulls ideas for train and bus center
articles.description: Roanoke roared about getting passenger service. A new train station could be next, but those talks are barely above a whisper.

articles.author: BY FRANK GREEN Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Joseph M. Giarratano, controversial former death row inmate, granted parole
articles.description: After 38 years behind bars and a close brush with execution for a rape and double murder that supporters have long claimed he did not commit, Joseph M. Giarratano has been granted parole.

articles.author: By Ellen Robertson Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Holocaust survivor Rosalia Kaplan, who was liberated from Auschwitz when she was 11, died this week
articles.description: RICHMOND — On a frigid day in January 1945, the Soviet Army liberated more than 7,000 remaining inmates of the Auschwitz concentration camp in Poland, including an 11-year-old Dutch Jewish girl named Rosalia Cato Kats.

articles.author: BY PATRICK WILSON Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: After backing marijuana decriminalization, Sen. Norment stops short with bill
articles.description: After saying he was open to decriminalization of marijuana, the state GOP's powerful Senate leader disappointed reform advocates by filing a bill that stops short.
